item.title: sensitivity and specificity
item.description: Sensitivity (True positive) Link to heading =Positive among all true Sensitivity is for describing how sensitive a classifier or test is. Given a “true”, the probability of spotting this “true” is called sensitivity. $$ \text{Sensitivity}=P(positive|true) $$ For example, blood screening is used for spotting disease. Sensitivity of blood screening means the probability of getting a positive result when that person is actually sick. A sensitive blood test will spot all sick people and even take healthy people as sick (low specificity).
